node.title: There's been a huge spike in injured and unwell turtles in south-east Queensland — but it's hard to work out why
node.alt: Sea turtle swims in ocean off south-east Queensland
node.description: Turtle rehabilitation centres say a large number of animals have required medical assistance this year, with many suffering from "floating syndrome", which can have a number of causes.
node.content:
["There has\u00a0been a \"massive spike\" in the amount of injured and unwell sea turtles needing care in south-east Queensland, turtle experts say.", "Veterinarians at Sea World on the Gold Coast have already seen a record 80 turtles come into their\u00a0facility this year.", "Turtle rehabilitation coordinator Siobhan Houlihan said that number was already \"a good 25 to 30 turtles higher than last year\".", "The previous high for a year was in 2014 when 71 turtles were cared for at the centre.", "To the north, Australia Zoo have had 79 turtles come into their care from the Gold Coast, Redlands, Moreton Bay and Sunshine Coast regions \u2014\u00a0easily the most in recent years.", "Many turtles brought into Sea World suffered from \"floating syndrome\", which could\u00a0be caused by multiple factors, including parasites and poor water quality.", "", "
Sick sea turtle rescued from Moreton Bay off south-east Queensland.(Supplied: Redcliffe Environmental Forum)
", "Ms Houlihan said despite that inherent information gap, turtles were affected by \"a lot of things that are caused by humans\".", "Other ailments included boat strikes and fishing line entanglement or ingestion.", "In the case of turtles found floating after boat strikes, vet Claire Madden said it was impossible to tell which\u00a0happened first.", "\"Are they sick to begin with and then they are floating? Therefore, they are more likely to be hit because they are already floating,\" she said.", "
Weather impacts on turtle welfare
", "", "
Rehabilitated sea turtle returned to Moreton Bay off south-east Queensland.(Supplied: Redcliffe Environmental Forum)
", "Weather conditions are\u00a0also likely to have played a role.", "Queensland Parks and Wildlife senior conservation officer Ian Bell said this sort of uptick \"really is closely linked to the El Ni\u00f1o Southern Oscillation Index, and it can have a positive or a negative effect\".", "Dr Bell said in strong El Ni\u00f1o conditions there was less rainfall and more sunlight penetration of the sea water, excellent conditions for sea grass growth.", "\"A year or so after a strong El Ni\u00f1o event, we see a very high nesting season because there's lots of nice, fat adult females that are ready to go and lay eggs,\" Dr Bell said.", "\"On the other hand, if we have\u00a0a strong La Ni\u00f1a incidence\u00a0\u2026 we see a lot of rainfall, a lot of runoff, the waters very turbid, and sunlight penetration is poor so the sea grass doesn't go so well.\"", "While the importance of the Great Barrier Reef as a breeding and nesting ground for turtles is widely known, the role of Moreton Bay as a foraging ground garners\u00a0less attention.", "Six of the seven marine turtle species that live in Australian waters can be found in the sea grass-rich environment of the bay between breeding seasons in the waters of the Great Barrier Reef.", "Dr Bell said the effect sediment could have on this crucial food source was \"a bit like throwing a tarpaulin over your lawn\".", "\"Typically, we get those really turbid waters after those heavy rainfalls and then flushing off of the land through the rivers and creeks and eventually out into the bays and along the coast,\" he said.", "When\u00a0sea grass was malnourished, so too could\u00a0turtles be, particularly younger animals with less body fat to survive on through winter.", "
'There's more pollution in the bay'
", "", "
People rescue a sick sea turtle from beach at Moreton Bay off south-east Queensland.(Supplied: Redcliffe Environmental Forum)
", "Quandamooka Aboriginal Land and Sea Management Agency manager Darren Burns said the sediment's impact on water quality was\u00a0visible.", "\"I've been on the island all my life \u2014 I can see the dirty brown water that once upon a time was confined to the southern bay islands \u2014 that dirty brown water comes all the way up to Peel Island these days,\" he said.", "Mr Burns said \"there is significant habitant change and alteration\" occurring in the region.", "\"Without accurate statistics and figures, it'd be very hard to put your finger on sediment as the principal cause,\" he said.", "\"But you could take a step back and you can go back to the population growth \u2014 there's more people, there's more vessels, there's more pollution in the bay.\"", "Mr Burns said there was evidence that high concentrations of pollutants following similar mapping to\u00a0sediment in the bay.", "While there was data that showed\u00a0turtles foraging in coastal areas had\u00a0much higher toxicity levels than their open water counterparts, Dr Bell said what effect those pollutants might be having on turtles was unclear.", "\"We've certainly got a much better idea of how pollutant levels are impacting on humans and on mammals \u2014 but on reptiles, we don't know,\" he said.", "
More humans means more problems for the turtles
", "The consistent and prolonged growth of the human population of the south-east worries\u00a0people involved with the turtles in\u00a0the region.", "\"The denser our population gets, the more likely we are to have problems with wildlife and humans,\" Dr Madden said.", "", "
Vet Dr Claire Madden and turtle rehabilitation coordinator Siobhan Houlihan with a rescued sea turtle in the pool at Sea World on Queensland's Gold Coast.(ABC News: Julius Dennis)
", "Queensland was the only state to grow significantly during the 2020-21 financial year.", "During the same period, over 33,000 new building applications were approved for the Gold Coast, Greater Brisbane\u00a0and Sunshine Coast regions.", "Mr Burns said the increasing population of people using the marine park could negatively influence the sea life of the bay, including turtles.", "\"There's a lot of people in the water these days \u2014 Moreton Bay is just a finite area,\" he said.", "\"It's inevitable \u2014 there's turtle strikes, there's dugong strikes, whale strikes \u2014 and it just goes hand in hand with population growth.\"", "Despite what many see as clear anecdotal evidence that the bay was busier than ever before, the number of boats registered in\u00a0the region has only grown incrementally.", "Mr Burns said many were not respecting designated go-slow zones that were in place to protect wildlife.", "Boat strikes are worrying, but Dr Madden said recreational fishing and the widespread use of crab pots in the region was a greater threat to the turtle population.", "\"Too often these pots are put out for days \u2014 they should be put out in the evening and checked first light in the morning \u2014 that's just not happening,\" she said.", "\"The fact that we were pulling crab pots from Pumicestone Passage with the skeletal remains of a turtle gives you some indication of how long that crab pot had been sitting there.\"", "
Green turtle numbers rebounding from 'zero baseline'
", "Dr Bell said he was optimistic, particularly for the green turtle stock of Moreton Bay\u00a0whose population has rebounded from a \"zero baseline\" after being decimated by the turtle soup industry of the 1920s and 1930s.", "\"The southern Great Barrier Reef green turtle genetic stock is increasing [and] has been for the last 40 years,\" he said.", "Dr Madden does not expect people to stop enjoying the Moreton Bay region.", "\"At the end of the day, it's such a beautiful location and people are just out there enjoying it,\" she said.", "\"There are options to have sustainable, biodegradable fishhooks and fishing line for example, or having a different motivator to check their crab pots more frequently.\""]
